data.title: Breaking Down the 2023
data.meta_description: Hardwood Knocks is joined by Justin Russo to discuss the ins, outs, ups, downs and, heck, even diagonals of the 2023-24 LA Clippers.
data.text:
Listen to “LA Clippers 2023-24 Lookahead” on Spreaker.

Dan is joined by Justin Russo (@FlyByKnite), who covers the LA Clippers and NBA at large on Substack to discuss—YOU GUESSED IT—the trajectory of the 2023-24 Clippers. And yes, out of obligation, they do delve into the James Harden trade rumors and his potential fit on this roster. SUBSCRIBE TO JUSTIN’S SUBSTACK HERE. TIMESTAMPS⬇️

0:00 – INTRO

2:08 – What went wrong last season?

6:04 – Do Kawhi Leonard and Paul George deserve criticism for their availability?

9:48 – Will Kawhi play back-to-backs? How have he and PG looked so far?

13:42 – Will Kawhi or PG sign an extension?

16:07 – The Russell Westbrook fit

19:48 – The importance of Terance Mann

26:01 – Robert Covington is critical to the rotation

28:09 – K.J. Martin’s role

31:18 – Diagnosing the Clippers’ defensive problems, Tactical adjustments from Ivica Zubac

37:06 – How much faster will the Clippers offense play?

41:03 – Brandon Boston Jr.

42:56 – Kobe Brown

44:02 – Bones Hyland

46:01 – Prospective fit of James Harden

53:32 – Are the Clippers prepared to make another trade if they don’t get Harden?

55:57 – The future of Marcus Morris Sr.

56:41 – The 10-man rotation, Who is in the starting five?

1:01:28 – Best crunch-time unit

1:02:-57 – Weirdo lineups we want to see

1:03:46 – Win total prediction, Where do the Clippers stack up in the regular season?

1:06:03 – The new arena, Final thoughts

FOLLOW US ON SOCIAL MEDIA⬇️

JOIN OUR DISCORD CHANNEL⬇️

Hardwood Knocks Chitchat

Thank you for listening to Hardwood Knocks, Episode 981. Please consider returning for even more content in the future—and throwing us that permanent subscription wherever you get your podcasts and on YouTube. We appreciate every single one of you more than you know.
